definition: standing image (of a Buddha or saint)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: Us two things on both sides of a life-size statue of lucky boy.
sentences.chinese: 我們面前東西兩側設有兩尊真人大小的招財童子立像。

sentences.english: I forgot to shoot her standing there. I was nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了拍她的立像了，我很緊張。

definition: seated image (of a Buddha or saint)
icon/iconic/religious image/figure (of Confucius, Buddha, Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1]
Buddhist image/statue of Buddha or Bodhisattva/CL:尊[zun1], 張|张[zhang1]
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
white marble/a type of white marble used for building and sculpting
niche for statue (esp. Buddhist, Christian etc)
